title: Improving Rice Modeling Success Rate with Ternary Non-structural Fertilizer Response Model.
authorString: Li J, Zhang M, Chen F, Yao B.

affiliation: Soil and Fertilizer Institute, Fujian Academy of Agricultural Science, Fuzhou, 350013, China.
Soil and Fertilizer Institute, Fujian Academy of Agricultural Science, Fuzhou, 350013, China.
Key Laboratory of Aquatic Botany and Watershed Ecology, Wuhan Botanical Garden, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Wuhan, 430074, China. cf87510433@163.com.
Fujian Cropland Construction and Soil and Fertilizer Station, Fuzhou, 350003, China.

abstractText: Fertilizer response modelling is an important technical approach to realize metrological fertilization on rice. With the goal of solving the problems of a low success rate of a ternary quadratic polynomial model (TPFM) and to expand the model's applicability, this paper established a ternary non-structural fertilizer response model (TNFM) based on the experimental results from N, P and K fertilized rice fields. Our research results showed that the TNFM significantly improved the modelling success rate by addressing problems arising from setting the bias and multicollinearity in a TPFM. The results from 88 rice field trials in China indicated that the proportion of typical TNFMs that satisfy the general fertilizer response law of plant nutrition was 40.9%, while the analogous proportion of TPFMs was only 26.1%. The recommended fertilization showed a significant positive linear correlation between the two models, and the parameters N0, P0 and K0 that estimated the value of soil supplying nutrient equivalents can be used as better indicators of yield potential in plots where no N or P or K fertilizer was applied. The theoretical analysis showed that the new model has a higher fitting accuracy and a wider application range.
affiliation: Soil and Fertilizer Institute, Fujian Academy of Agricultural Science, Fuzhou, 350013, China.
